question: February 2013 - Question 146 The region's population is 100,000 people, every year there are 1,000 cases of a disease in the population and 100 people die of the disease. What is the specific death rate and the rate of death of this disease respectively?
options: One in a thousand – ten percent
One in a thousand – one percent
One in ten thousand – ten percent
One in a hundred – one percent
answerText: One in a thousand – ten percent

A decline in mortality rate to 50 per thousand in children under one year old
Having an appropriate ratio of height and weight in all stages of their lives
answerText: Having an appropriate ratio of height and weight in all stages of their lives

question: September 2020 - Question 153 A persistent disease with high prevalence, similarly affecting all ages is called?
September 2020 - Question 154 Which of the following definitions is more in line with “health education”?
options: The transfer of health knowledge to people with limited knowledge about disease prevention.
A series of activities planned to improve health condition of the society.
The change process is a behavior that establishes a link between health knowledge and its implementations.
A type of education that provides the necessary information about healthy lifestyle to individuals.
answerText: The change process is a behavior that establishes a link between health knowledge and its implementations.

question: September 2020 - Question 155 All of the following belong to primary health care elements EXCEPT?
September 2020 - Question 156 Which of the following options denotes the most important concept of “health promotion”?
options: Enabling people to decide on their own health
Enhancing people's health information to change their behavior
Changing people's health culture for social and economic development
Establishing intra-sectorial coordination for social health development
answerText: Enabling people to decide on their own health

question: September 2020 - Question 157 All of the following statements are true about nosocomial infection EXCEPT?
options: The patient is without infection on admission.
The infection signs and symptoms of the disease may appear after discharge.
The infection originates from hospital equipment and services.
The patient has been in the incubation period of infection on admission.
answerText: The patient has been in the incubation period of infection on admission.

question: September 2020 - Question 158 The clinical examination of the breast and fastening the seat belt in a vehicle are considered as ............. prevention, respectively.
September 2020 - Question 159 The virulence of a pathogenic agent to enter, survive and proliferate in the host is known as ............ .

March 2021 - Question 149 A person presents with symptoms which can suggest colon cancer; his/her condition is confirmed after physical examination and medical tests. Which of the following terms is applied to this state?
March 2021 - Question 150 Which of the following is needed for assessing neonatal mortality rate? The number of ……..
options: Neonatal deaths younger than 28 days at a certain period and the average population of the country at the same period
Neonatal deaths younger than 1 year and the number of live births at the same period
Neonatal deaths younger than 28 days and the number of live births at the same period
Maternal deaths due to delivery, the number of live births at a certain period, and the average population of the country at the same period
answerText: Neonatal deaths younger than 28 days and the number of live births at the same period

question: March 2021 - Question 151 What is meant by the comprehensive primary health care services?
options: Providing resources and facilities to all people in the community regardless of their differences
Employing all facilities, means, methods and human resources fitting the conditions of the community in the provision of healthcare services
Engaging all individuals in the community in the development, maintenance and the use of health services and prevention
Including promotional, preventive and rehabilitative interventions in primary health care services
answerText: Including promotional, preventive and rehabilitative interventions in primary health care services

question: March 2021 - Question 152 Which of the following is regarded as a promotional intervention about 'diarrhea' within the framework of primary health care?

March 2021 - Question 153 According to the national strategy of cooperation between the Islamic Republic of Iran and WHO…………….. is among the most important strategic aspects of WHO cooperation with Iran.
options: Coping with the consequences of demographic and epidemiologic transition
Reforms in the health information system
answerText: Coping with the consequences of demographic and epidemiologic transition

question: March 2021 - Question 154 According to the fourth stage of planning model of Precede-Proceed (Educational and Ecological Evaluation), which of the following factors belongs to reinforcing factors?
options: Attitudes and behaviors of health staff and peers
Beliefs and knowledge of individuals about a certain topic
answerText: Attitudes and behaviors of health staff and peers

question: March 2021 - Question 155 According to the model of change stages (Prochaska et al., 1979), to which stages does a person in the following condition belong? 'In the behavior change process, a person realizes a problem during behavior change and considers the behavior change but is not yet ready to accept the obligation to change.'
March 2021 - Question 156 Which of the following is among the technical challenges of environmental health?
options: Awareness of headquarters procedures used in programs of environmental health management
Understanding the general problems of environmental health and health priorities
Capability of determining acceptability and taking legal measures
Awareness of food-borne diseases and ways of controlling them
answerText: Awareness of food-borne diseases and ways of controlling them

question: March 2021 - Question 157 Which of the following techniques is used in occupational health to investigate machine-human interference and detect potential errors of human performance, such as surgeons' duties?
March 2021 - Question 158 In an interview to determine students' health status, they are asked, 'Have you ever caught X disease?' Their response can help us determine ......... .

March 2021 - Question 159 A randomized clinical trial on the effect of two drugs showed different results. If the two drugs actually have the same effect in reality, this would be an example of ......... .

March 2021 - Question 160 Which of the following research designs is suitable for this context: 'Did mothers with newborns suffering from cataract have more exposure to rubella during a rubella epidemic than mothers with non-cataract newborns?'
June 2021 - Question 149 Which of the following is correct about the definitions of 'health'?
options: The definition of health is influenced by different cultural and geographical conditions.
According to the statistical definition of health, the prevalence of a psychologically abnormal trait is not considered normal in society.
The dynamics of the health process have no effect on its concept over time.
In the statistical model of health definition, all values within two standard deviations from the mean are normal.
answerText: The definition of health is influenced by different cultural and geographical conditions.

question: June 2021 - Question 150 In an area, the size of the spleen in 2-to-9-year-old children is more than 50%, and in adults, it is more than 25%. According to the World Health Organization classification of Endemic Malaria, which class does this region fall into?
June 2021 - Question 151 To calculate the sensitivity of a screening test, which of the following data are needed for the numerator?
options: Number of healthy (normal) individuals diagnosed as negative
Number of unhealthy individuals diagnosed as negative
Number of healthy (normal) individuals diagnosed as positive
Number of unhealthy individuals diagnosed as positive
answerText: Number of unhealthy individuals diagnosed as positive

question: June 2021 - Question 152 Which of the following is correct about defining the periodic prevalence of diseases?
options: The total number of people who had a disease or feature at any given time in a given period.
The total number of people infected with a particular disease or feature at a given point in time.
The total number of people with the disease or feature at any time during the year.
The number of people who had the disease or feature at least once in their lives.
answerText: The total number of people who had a disease or feature at any given time in a given period.

question: June 2021 - Question 153 Which of the following is among the general challenges of environmental health?

June 2021 - Question 154 In a smoking cessation program, if necessary support is provided by the cultural centers to which a person belongs, which level of impact has been considered in this program based on the social ecological model (McLeroy et al.)?

June 2021 - Question 155 In a society with a high prevalence of skin cancer, experts intend to promote the use of sunscreen through the theory of innovation diffusion. In the process of program implementation and classification of individuals, a group of them were interested in performing the behavior but needed external motivation to accept the behavior. What category does this group fall into?
June 2021 - Question 156 Which UN organizations or programs are directly involved in health development?
options: United Nations Educational, Scientific, and Cultural Organization
Organization of the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons

question: June 2021 - Question 157 Which of the following is correct about the purpose of the measles control program in the world?
options: Reduction of measles cases by 100% by 1995
Reduction of measles deaths by 95% by 1995
Increase in measles vaccination coverage to more than 50%
Increase in measles vaccination coverage to more than 90%
answerText: Increase in measles vaccination coverage to more than 90%

question: June 2021 - Question 158 Within the framework of primary health care, which of the following statements for 'Anemia' falls into the group of therapeutic interventions?
June 2021 - Question 159 Which of the following is NOT correct about primary health care?
options: Primary health care services cover all prevention, promotion, therapeutic, and rehabilitative services.
The complexity of health control in health care centers is less than at the community level.
The frequency of health problems in the community is higher than in hospitals.
In promotional interventions in primary health care, the impact on the underlying causes of health problems is considered.
answerText: The complexity of health control in health care centers is less than at the community level.

question: June 2021 - Question 160 Which hazard identification technique in occupational health is applicable to all accidents?
September 2021 - Question 149 Which of the following is NOT true about the definitions of “Health”?
options: Health is not an absolute concept.
The concept of health is influenced by time.
The definition of health is not influenced by different cultural situations.
The definition of health is influenced by individuals’ knowledge.
answerText: The definition of health is not influenced by different cultural situations.

question: September 2021 - Question 150 A person presents with symptoms suggesting gastric cancer which is not confirmed after physical examination and medical tests. Which of the following terms is applied to this situation?
September 2021 - Question 151 Which of the following statements is correct about the evaluation indicators of Health for All (HFA)?
options: Spending at least 20% of GDP on health
Giving birth to at least 60% of infants with more than 2500gr birth weight
Increasing life expectancy at birth to more than 70 years
Increasing the literacy rate to more than 70% in the whole population
answerText: Increasing life expectancy at birth to more than 70 years

question: September 2021 - Question 152 Which of the following is the most accurate statement about using appropriate methods as one of the principles of providing primary health care?
options: Using methods, tools, equipment and staff in providing care by taking into account the capital and current costs
Using methods, tools, equipment and staff in providing care, in accordance with the community’s needs and socioeconomic conditions
Using methods, tools, equipment and staff in providing care in a way that is acceptable to the community
Using methods, tools, equipment and staff to provide care in the areas where it is mostly needed
answerText: Using methods, tools, equipment and staff in providing care, in accordance with the community’s needs and socioeconomic conditions

question: September 2021 - Question 153 Which of the following is regarded as a therapeutic intervention about “Tuberculosis” within the framework of primary health care?
September 2021 - Question 154 Which of the following is NOT considered as the goal of the United Nations International Children's Emergency Fund (UNICEF)?
options: Promoting respect for human rights, especially for women
Enhancing awareness and capacity building to meet the needs of family planning
Following social justice in developing programs related to children
Guiding children-related laws, policies and measures
answerText: Enhancing awareness and capacity building to meet the needs of family planning

question: September 2021 - Question 155 In order to measure the specificity of a screening test, which of the following data are needed for the denominator?
September 2021 - Question 156 If the prevalence of a disease in an area starts from the beginning of life and mostly affects children, while it is less prevalent in adults, it is a/an ……… disease.
September 2021 - Question 157 In the process of controlling human environmental-related diseases, the basic environmental health strategy focuses on ……… .
options: the source and modes of disease transmission
individuals’ sensitivity and control of pathogens in the environment
the source, modes of disease transmission, and individuals’ sensitivity
pathogens, modes of disease transmission, and reservoirs
answerText: the source, modes of disease transmission, and individuals’ sensitivity

question: September 2021 - Question 158 In a society, experts intend to promote the Quit Smoking Program through the stages of the Change Theory. In the planning and classification process, some individuals notice the side effects of smoking and plan to quit smoking. What category does this group fall into?
September 2021 - Question 159 Which of the following factors belongs to enabling factors according to the planning model of Precede-Proceed (Educational and Ecological Evaluation)?
September 2021 - Question 160 Which of the following measures is taken at the “Identification” stage as one of the administrative phases in occupational health?
November 2021 - Question 149 In the administrative operations of occupational health, which of the following measures should be taken after determining the risk?

November 2021 - Question 150 According to the principles of environmental health, in the process of controlling human diseases in which the environment is involved, pest management is one of the measures in ..........
November 2021 - Question 151 According to the principles of environmental health, which of the following measures is used in human disease control processes in which the environment is involved?
options: Isolating the healthy individuals during the period of disease transmission
Educating people and changing the health-related habits and behaviors
Providing proper housing and environmental health
answerText: Educating people and changing the health-related habits and behaviors

question: November 2021 - Question 152 Which of the following is correct about the definition of health promotion?
options: It refers to the activities performed to increase people's awareness and knowledge about health-related issues.
It is a set of changes made in the economic and social environment in order to create a suitable environment for changing health behavior.
It is a set of educational actions and environmental supports that takes place to change health behaviors.
It is a set of actions that aims to bridge the gap between attitude and awareness.
answerText: It is a set of educational actions and environmental supports that takes place to change health behaviors.

question: November 2021 - Question 153 If we use the social marketing planning model in the health promotion program to help others quit smoking, which of the following is considered a product?
options: Walking from home to the smoking cessation center
Experiencing physical discomfort caused by smoking cessation
Informing others about smoking cessation strategies via the Internet

question: November 2021 - Question 154 If you want to calculate the total fertility rate in a community, which of the following information do you need for the numerator?
options: Number of births in a given period

question: November 2021 - Question 155 The prevalence rate of a disease depends on the ..........
options: average duration of disease, the number of disease cases
number of new disease cases, mortality rate
point prevalence rate, period prevalence rate
incidence rate, average duration of the disease
answerText: incidence rate, average duration of the disease

question: November 2021 - Question 156 Which of the following interventions is considered in the comprehensive approach to primary health care?
November 2021 - Question 157 Which of the following is true about nosocomial infections?
options: The person who is referred to the hospital has been infected on arrival.
The person who is referred to the hospital has been in the incubation period on arrival.
The patient shows symptoms of the disease after discharge from the hospital.
It is originated from outside the hospital and symptoms occur on admission.
answerText: The patient shows symptoms of the disease after discharge from the hospital.

question: November 2021 - Question 158 Which of the following is true about biological transmission?
options: Infection agent enters the susceptible host's body through the biological products, including the blood and serum.
The infection agent necessarily goes through the incubation period in the body of an arthropod after entry.
It occurs through contamination of the oral appendages or the passage of the infection agent through the gastrointestinal tract of the insect without the need for reproduction.
The infection agent is transmitted directly into the mouth and conjunctiva of the eye after reproduction in humid physical environment.
answerText: The infection agent necessarily goes through the incubation period in the body of an arthropod after entry.

question: November 2021 - Question 159 A person's feeling about his/her health and its effect on his/her daily life is referred to as .............
November 2021 - Question 160 Which of the following is true about the definition of mental health?
options: Ability of establishing the relationships and maintaining them
Ability of rational and clear thinking
Absence of obvious psychological disease or problems
Ability of recognizing and understanding the emotions
answerText: Ability of rational and clear thinking

question: March 2022 - Question 149 Which of the following is correct about the endemic disease?
options: A disease that has a high prevalence at the beginning of life, reaches equilibrium in adults and is less common in children than adults.
High and persistent prevalence of infectious diseases in an area that is measurable and affects most children.
A disease that is permanently present with a high prevalence or incidence and affects all ages equally.
Permanent presence (at least for 3 consecutive years) of a disease or infectious agent in a certain geographical area or population.
answerText: Permanent presence (at least for 3 consecutive years) of a disease or infectious agent in a certain geographical area or population.

question: March 2022 - Question 150 According to the formula determined by the World Health Organization, to calculate the prenatal mortality rate, which of the following options do we need in the denominator of the deduction?
options: Number of fetal deaths (28 weeks pregnancy) or more
Number of live births in a year
Number of deaths in the first week of life
Number of deaths in the first week of life plus the number of fetal deaths
answerText: Number of live births in a year

question: March 2022 - Question 151 All of the following organizations are directly involved in health development EXCEPT ……… .
March 2022 - Question 152 According to the social marketing planning model, to change the behavior of 'waste separation at home', which of the following marketing principles is included?
March 2022 - Question 153 Which of the following is the index disease of water-related insect-borne diseases?

March 2022 - Question 154 According to which of the theories and models of behavior change, adolescents are more likely to smoke without the need for direct experience and only by observing drug use by friends?

March 2022 - Question 155 A person presents with symptoms of breast cancer but her condition is not confirmed after physical examination and medical tests (no particular indication is detected). Which of the following terms is applied to this state?
March 2022 - Question 156 Which of the following is correct about the statistical definition of normal (health)?
options: In the majority of societies with different conditions, all human characteristics follow the normal distribution.
It is possible to use the same model for the distribution of human characteristics in all societies for correct judgment.
To judge the distribution of some characteristics such as weight in a society, it is not necessary to determine the characteristics of that society.
Prevalence of an abnormal trait in the psychological dimension of a society is sometimes considered normal.
answerText: Prevalence of an abnormal trait in the psychological dimension of a society is sometimes considered normal.

question: March 2022 - Question 157 Which of the following is correct about the basic philosophy of 'Primary Health Care'?
options: Fair distribution of health resources in the society
Reducing the prevalence of diseases by providing preventive interventions
Use of local facilities and resources in providing services
Coordinating different sections of society that affect people's health
answerText: Fair distribution of health resources in the society

question: March 2022 - Question 158 Which of the following is correct about 'Primary Health Care'?
options: Based on PHC service levels, basic medical treatment services are provided in general hospitals.
The health problems of the majority of people are related to the third level of the PHC pyramid.
The complexity of health care is less at the basic level of the PHC pyramid.
In PHC, comprehensiveness of services means providing a set of promotional and prevention services.
answerText: The complexity of health care is less at the basic level of the PHC pyramid.

question: August 2022 - Question 149 Which of the following is needed to calculate the Sullivan Index?
options: Life expectancy - possible duration of hospitalization and inability to perform major functions
Quality of life - degree of disability - life expectancy at birth
Economic status - death rate in children under one year of age - life expectancy
Probable duration of hospitalization and inability to perform major functions - mortality rate - quality of life
answerText: Quality of life - degree of disability - life expectancy at birth

question: August 2022 - Question 150 All the following options about primary health care are correct, EXCEPT:
options: The frequency of health-related problems at the level of health centers is lower than that of hospitals
Based on the classification of services in primary health care, basic treatment services are provided in Health Houses
Access to mental health care is not among the minimum mandatory measures for all communities
In promotional interventions in primary health care, the impact on the basic causes of health problems is focused on
answerText: Access to mental health care is not among the minimum mandatory measures for all communities

question: August 2022 - Question 151 Which of the following interventions includes the provision of social integration services in controlling the tuberculosis disease?

August 2022 - Question 153 Which of the following is correct about the unfulfilled goals of the World Health Organization regarding acute respiratory infections (ARI)?
options: One-third reduction in the mortality rate of children under 5 years of age due to ARI in the 1990s
Complete elimination of ARI in children in developing countries by 2000
A 95% reduction in ARI mortality rate in the 1990s
Eradication of ARI by 2000 in all countries with different socioeconomic conditions
answerText: Complete elimination of ARI in children in developing countries by 2000

question: August 2022 - Question 154 Which of the following conferences approved the primary health care as the key to achieve the goal of 'Health for All'?
options: The last International Health Conference in 1938
The Joint International Conference of WHO and UNICEF in 1978
The First International Health Conference in 1851
answerText: The Joint International Conference of WHO and UNICEF in 1978

question: August 2022 - Question 155 Based on the social marketing model in the cigarette health promotion program, which of the following items is considered as a cost?
options: Participating in a smoking cessation workshop
Walking the distance to the smoking cessation center
answerText: Walking the distance to the smoking cessation center

question: August 2022 - Question 156 Surveys in the urban areas of the country show that an important factor that affects the physical activity status of young people is the lack of proper physical activity among their friends. Based on the precede-proceed model, which of the following items involves this important factor?

August 2022 - Question 157 If the rules for maintaining the quality of food products are established and implemented to prevent human diseases induced by the environment, which of the following basic elements of environmental health is used?

August 2022 - Question 159 Which of the risk identification techniques in occupational health is used to investigate human error in work performance?
August 2022 - Question 160 Which of the following is correct about the definition of gradient of infection?
options: Manifestation of illness in the host that indicates his/her reaction to an infectious agent.
The length of time that an infectious agent can be directly transmitted from an infected person to another.
The time interval between the onset of the causal effect of an infectious agent and the development of disease symptoms.
The time intervals of infectious diseases incidence in a community based on the immunity status of people.
answerText: The time interval between the onset of the causal effect of an infectious agent and the development of disease symptoms.

question: August 2023 - Question 149 During recent years, using asbestos in petrochemical industries is prohibited. By this action, which preventive measure has been mentioned?
options: Prevention of unnecessary and excessive treatment

options: To prevent unnecessary and excessive treatment
